data.title: XNA test project is not working after last texturing commit
data.body:
I mean MonoGame.Tests.XNA is not compilable after https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/3991. There is a bunch of errors. Even after muting it a bit the func called CompressDefault is not correctly working

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3036176/8753528/28ffb6de-2cc5-11e5-956e-ee426000b04b.png)

(TextureProcessorOutputFormat.Compressed is not exist in XNA)

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Fixed Enum loading
data.body:
Stuff done:
- instead of having specific enum loading for each enum, I just added a code that works for all enums and any future enums
- fixes not being able to set DebugMode for Effect Processor

data.title: Updated OpenTK Window
data.body:
With this I've done several things:
- made the fullscreen not change the resolution but instead just stretch the viewport
  - this also fixes a bug when there are multiple monitors connected, on Linux it would disable the second monitor, and not correctly return their positions properly
- made the fullscreen switchable during runtime
- set the window to try and load the information from itself(assembly) if possible
- Updated to the newest dependencies
  - contains a fix for Mouse Cursor being reset(moved) to the window bound after it looses focus

data.title: Fixes for TextureImporter + tests
data.body:
Update submodule reference to get updated FreeImageNET.dll for Windows.
Added support for importing GIF files.
Added TextureImporter tests for bmp, gif, jpg, png, tga and tif.

data.title: GamePadState.PacketNumber fix(WinDX)
data.body: Fix for https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/4002

data.title: GamePad.GetState(PlayerIndex.One).PacketNumber not Returning Value on Windows
data.body: When developing for Windows, using an Xbox 360 controller, the GamePadState.PacketNumber property doesn't appear to change when buttons, sticks, or triggers on the controller are pressed.

data.title: Input - GetVirtualButtons() incorrectly reports LeftThumbstickDown all the time
MGCB - TextureImporter fails since upgrade to 3.5.0.344
data.body:
I recently upgraded the Monogame sdk to version 3.5.0.344 but now the content pipeline tool won't build nor rebuild my games content anymore.

MBCB settings:
/outputDir:bin
/intermediateDir:obj
/platform:Windows
/config:
/profile:HiDef
/compress:False

Content:
# begin Shader/blurGauss.fx

/importer:EffectImporter
/processor:EffectProcessor
/processorParam:DebugMode=Auto
/build:Shader/blurGauss.fx
# begin Textures/Animation/anms_sea_level_1.png

/importer:TextureImporter
/processor:TextureProcessor
/processorParam:ColorKeyColor=255,0,255,255
/processorParam:ColorKeyEnabled=True
/processorParam:GenerateMipmaps=False
/processorParam:PremultiplyAlpha=True
/processorParam:ResizeToPowerOfTwo=False
/processorParam:MakeSquare=False
/processorParam:TextureFormat=Color
/build:Textures/Animation/anms_sea_level_1.png
...

Shader compilation seems to work fine. (Are finished without any errors)
But texture compiling results in the following error:

> Importer 'TextureImporter' had unexpected failure!
> System.NullReferenceException
> 
> Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.TextureImporter.Import(String filename, ContentImporterContext context)
> 
> Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentImporter`1.Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentImporter.Import(String filename, ContentImporterContext context)
> 
> MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent(PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent)

This error messages repeats for every texture content within my content project...

What I tried:
-Uninstall and reinstall Monogame sdk
-Delete and recreate mgcb project

I would appreciate any help or advice from your side...
I know it's a unstable version of the sdk. I switched to a newer version to track down
another problem I encountered while working on my project and wanted to know
if this problem might be already fixed.

Let me know if you need any further information...

data.title: Fix preprocessor not working correctly when included files don't end with a newline
data.body: Fixes problem 1 in #3853.

data.title: Fixed MGCB Crashes
data.body: MGCB would crash when there was an item that did not have an importer, fixes #3960

data.title: Fix missing reference to FreeImageNET on Windows
data.body:
Doing a plain checkout of develop, I was unable to compile the content pipeline project. Applying this change fixes that.

It looks like the location of the FreeImage library was moved in https://github.com/Mono-Game/MonoGame.Dependencies/commit/5b324d9eae92925b3d7acb0084879dc44d06727b.

data.title: Android : Housekeeping
data.body: - Fixed support for creating textures with a surface format of type SurfaceFormat.Bgra4444. An internal format of type Rgba4 was specified, which is not supported in GL.ES20. - Changed existing graphics capabilities checks when reading in a 2d texture to additionally apply to both iOS and Android platforms. In particular, Android devices vary widely, so there's no guarantee that all available texture compression formats will be supported. - Fixed GraphicsAdapter's DisplayMode dimensions so that immersive support is correctly handled. - Some other decoupling of the Game instance from internal content-reading logic, making it more consistent with the behaviour of other platforms.

data.title: Infinite loop caused by Game.Exit doesn't allow application to end

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
This bug is in the WinDX platform layer, I haven't looked at the others yet.

If you want to repro it the way I found it, it's also _really_ obscure, but the fact that it can happen at all is bad enough, right?

I was mucking around with what was left of the project template, and the call to Game.Exit ended up on the main code path. Imagine

``` C#
protected override void Update(GameTime gameTime)
{
    Exit();
    base.Update(gameTime);
}
```

That alone doesn't cause the bug though. For various reasons, I also had the [Visual Studio hosting process disabled](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms185330.aspx).
These two combined will have the game window pop up, close immediately and then indefinetely continue to run. Hitting the pause button in the debugger, I got this stack trace:

```
mscorlib.dll!System.Threading.Thread.Sleep(int millisecondsTimeout)
MonoGame.Framework.dll!MonoGame.Framework.WinFormsGameWindow.RunLoop()
MonoGame.Framework.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Run(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameRunBehavior runBehavior)
Game1.exe!Game1.Program.Main()
```

I assumed that Thread.Sleep was unlikely to be the cause of the infinite loop, so I looked at WinFormsGameWindow.cs. Looking at RunLoop(), there's only one call to Thread.Sleep, and it's inside [this loop](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Windows/WinFormsGameWindow.cs#L435-451).
Compared to the loop above it, it simply seems to lack `Application.DoEvents()` to actually pull out messages from the queue, but I have not tested this yet. I'm not sure why this seemingly never caused any issues before, but I assume calling Exit on the first update doesn't give the first loop enough time to clear the queue, and the queue would usually be empty anyway, unless the the hosting process is disabled?

But that's just conjecture. Unless one of the devs thinks it's obvious enough and fixes it themselves, I'll try and fix this myself and make a pull request later today or maybe tomorrow.

data.title: Fixed threading issue in OggStream
data.body: Fixes threading issue in OggStream, update rate was getting set after the thread... also added an extra check just in case.

data.title: Docs and Improvements
data.body:
New docs and improvements !

Description

Quaternion

-Docs for all things -New constructor which accepts single Vector4 -DebugDisplayString replaced to correct place -Concatenate,CreateFromAxisAngle,CreateFromYawPitchRoll,CreateFromYawPitchRoll,Conjugate, Equals,Normalize.. rewrited to more nice view(with new tests of course). -Redundant "this" and (double) conversion removed from some methods -Removed unused internal methods

All vectors

changed few docs

Vector4

-New constructor which accepts Quaternion -Added ToQuaternion method

Tests

-All vector tests rewrited to more compact view - added new Compare method which is usable for comparsion of float-point structs without redundant code. -New file for test called FPointBase -provide Compare method for comparsion between 2 floats. -Added new QuaternionTest which follows the rules above

data.title: BoundingSphere additional doc fixes.
data.body: Docs fixes according to request of @tomspilman.

data.title: Texture import and processing
data.body:
Texture import and processing is now more complete and more flexible.
- All format conversions go through 128-bit BGRA floating point format (Vector4).
- All major texture compression formats supported: PVR, DXT, ETC1, ATC.
- ETC1 falls back to BGRA4444 if the texture contains any non-opaque alpha values.
- ETC1 is must be square POT, same as PVR, as this is required on some PowerVR chipsets. This is the cause of the slight fuzziness on those images below as they were resized by the texture processor.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/694943/8601661/ce524dd8-26b0-11e5-840b-2dd580c44b81.png)

data.title: BoundingSphere docs + few other doc fixes
data.body: Docs for BoundingSphere. I didnt change the code inside methods so no tests needed. +Added new overload for Contains..

data.title: [WP8.1] MonoGame.Framework.StorageDevice throws NotSupportedException
data.body:
module [MonoGame.Framework.StorageDevice](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/master/MonoGame.Framework/Storage/StorageDevice.cs)

Throws the following:

System.NotSupportedException: Specified method is not supported.
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Storage.ShowSelectorAsynchronousShowNoPlayer.BeginInvoke(Int32 sizeInBytes, Int32 directoryCount, AsyncCallback callback, Object object)
at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Storage.StorageDevice.BeginShowSelector(Int32 sizeInBytes, Int32 directoryCount, AsyncCallback callback, Object state)

This happens in the BeginInvoke on the delegate.

data.title: Have project selected initially after opening a project.
data.body:
Upon opening a content project, the Pipeline Tool will now have the project selected (its properties displayed within the property grid) rather than the last-added content item.

Note: this is a windows-view-specific fix.

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Added message on MGCB Compiler process end
data.body: Fixes: #3960

data.title: Include Content Pipeline Tool in NuGet Packages
data.body: As I have my monogame projects in git I woul prefer to use Nuget-Packages instead of installations for better dependecy handling. Unfortunatly the NuGet-Package for MonoGame does not provide the content pipeline tool, so I needed to install MonoGame from the installer too. This is bad because now I have MonoGame twice installed + probably some issues when I switch to a different MonoGame Version in NuGet.

data.title: Bug with Monogame SpriteFont Importer
data.body:
Been having a problem with displaying Japanese characters in my app ever since using the monogame pipeline.

![help for charracters](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11158981/8512806/23c806f8-234c-11e5-88e4-4beced7ac4e2.jpg)

 So I look and found that the spriteFonts are imported by a new importer. I put a stop point in my program before it loaded the font and swaped the Font xnb generated by the monogame importer for one made by the Xna one, this seem to solve the problem i was having. 

![help for charracters4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11158981/8512809/30ac48d4-234c-11e5-8e43-8d992f8dab09.jpg)

Thought I should post this in case anyone else was having problems.

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Fixed moving action
data.body: Just added a temporary list to collect all the items before moving them, because otherwise it could happen that for loop skips over some item.

data.title: Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2 serializes incorrectly
data.body:
This seems to be a regression of https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2968, however with one slight caveat: the serialization now differs by platform.

Currently, with the 3.4 release version of Monogame, the following output occurs during serialization with Json.NET (for `foo.Position = new Vector2(-60, -60)`).

Windows: 
`"Position" : "-60, -60"`
Linux: 
`"Position": {
    "X": -60.0,
    "Y": -60.0
}`

The reason that we noticed this is because the Windows serialization does not correctly deserialize on Linux as would be expected. We have not yet tried to deserialize the Linux version on Windows.

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Updated MVC Model
data.body:
With this I moved bunch of stuff from view to controller that shouldn't have been in the view in the first place.

Stuff moved to controller:
- Menu Sensitivity
- Context Menu Visibility
- Rename
- Delete
- New Item
- Add Existing Item
- New Folder
- Add Existing Folder
- Expand Path

Why did I do this? Easier maintenance, plus helps with something I am working on....
